node.title: StressDivergenceBeam is not a registered object
node.bodyText:
I just built and compiled the latest version of moose and tried to run the example at
~/projects/moose/modules/solid_mechanics/test/tests/beam/static/euler_finite_rot_z.i
and I getting the following error
*** ERROR ***
A 'StressDivergenceBeam' is not a registered object.

If you are trying to find this object in a dynamically loaded library, make sure that
the library can be found either in your "Problem/library_path" parameter or in the
MOOSE_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable.

I compiled my app with all modules ... any clues on how to resolve this?
Thanks
-Clint

Did you first compile your app with all modules?
Or did you make that change recently?

I first compiled without any modules I believe and then realized that I didn't have any active and then turned them all on and recompiled. I am thinking that I may have had an old moose environment so I removed it and am rebuilding.  Hopefully that solves the issue.
Should I compile without any modules active first and then recompile? That's kind of how the installation walks you thru it.
You should clean the repository and possible the moose folder too then recompile

I wiped the moose directory and deleted the moose Conda env -- then recreated with
conda create -n moose moose-dev=2024.05.08
and then re-built moose and my app enabling all modules and reran the beam test and got the same result 'StressDivergenceBeam' is not a registered object its not just a beam none of my old moose files are working.  I must have screwed something up!

Yes this does not seem right
Run the disagnostics script in moose/scripts

Here's the return from diagnostic (failed portion)
FAIL: moose-dev/repository version mismatch
Your MOOSE repository requires moose-dev:
while your Conda environment has moose-dev:	2024.05.08
There are two ways to fix this:


To install the required Conda package version:
conda install moose-dev=


Or adjust your repository to be in sync with moose-dev Conda package.


Not sure how to make it be in sync?

what about the non-failed portion?
That error is fine, it will work anyway until you update moose again

Here's the entire output.  How should I go about updating moose again?
(moose) camorrow@ClintsMacStudio projects % ./moose/scripts/diagnostics.sh

node.title: Using MeshAlignmentVariableTransferMaterial in input file
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I'd like to use MeshAlignmentVariableTransferMaterial in the input file. But I do not know what the _mesh_alignment should be.

Or what should I change in the MeshAlignmentVariableTransferForBeesMaterial.C and .h file?
Thanks!

Hello
this is not meant to be created from an input file, but rather programmatically from a heat structure component for example
you can look at modules/thermal_hydraulics/src/components/HeatTransferFromHeatStructure1Phase.C to see how it is created and paired with a MeshAlignment object
Guillaume

It's not the right change then.
I would follow what is done in the heat structure for that material very closely
Thanks!

Hi @GiudGiud,
Could you please kindly tell me how to change this material?

You could work on retrieving that mesh alignement object programmatically if you dont want to create the Material programmatically
Unless you create the Material programmatically like the heat structure does, it will be hard to set the right _mesh_alignment parameter

You could work on retrieving that mesh alignement object programmatically

What does this mean? I still do not know how to do it.

The material takes a pointer to the meshAlignment object.
Since you cant provide the pointer, you could retrieve the object from the Problem (if it s a user object)
OK, thanks a lot!

node.title: WebServerControl for multiple sub apps
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I recently found out about the new WebServerControl feature and the Python MooseControl implementation.
I wanted to possibly use this feature to couple a simulation of aquifer thermal energy storage in MOOSE with other simulations and the Functional Mock-Up Interface in Python.
For both the hot and the cold well, I wanted to set up a separate app and dynamically switch on/off BCs in Python depeding on the wished operation.
My question here is whether it is possible to control multiple apps from Python? Or do I have to set up a parent multi-app that controls both apps and control it via Python's MooseControl?
And another small question: Is it possible to access the time step and the time step width via MooseControl in order to avoid the loop over a fixed number of steps in Python?
Thanks!

Hello

My question here is whether it is possible to control multiple apps from Python? Or do I have to set up a parent multi-app that controls both apps and control it via Python's MooseControl?

the latter is what you need to do.
Send a signal to control the activation of the BC from the main app, and modify that signal from the MooseControl.
I would use postrpcessors.
A ConstantPostprocessor on the main app, its value is controllable
A Receiver on the child app, to which the 'value' from the ConstantPP is being transferred using a MultiAppPostprocessorTransfer

node.title: Problem of CHF calculation in two phase flow
node.bodyText:
Hi @GiudGiud and @joshuahansel ,
I have developed a two-phase flow code (six-equation model) according to THM. I also use [FlowChannel2Phase], [HeatStructureCylindrical], and [HeatTransferFromHeatStructure2Phase] components, just like THM does.
Now I am doing the CHF calculation, but some unexpected oscillation occurred.

The T_wall in the solid region is [FIRST, LAGRANGE], but all variables in the 1-D fluid region are [CONSTANT, MONOMIAL]. I use ProjectionAux to show T_wall in elemental form. It may be correct.

But the T_wall in the solid region is still oscillating. Do you know the reason why the T_wall is oscillating? And how to fix this problem?

Hello
Did you try to refine the mesh?
Should you have some sort of limiters to capture that gradient in temperature more smoothly?
I imagine temperature is not the only variable with such a profile
Guillaume

The CFEM discretization in the heat structures is not immune to oscillations; if you have a sharp jump in the boundary conditions, this is possible. I don't think the ProjectionAux helps you, as it just masks the problem. The quick fixes to reduce the problem are refining the mesh and using a smoother transition in the boundary condition. The full fix would be some kind of change to the sptail scheme in the heat structure, like a stabilization of some kind, which I admit I haven't investigated yet (the oscillations I've encountered have not been so bad).

Hi @joshuahansel and @GiudGiud,
I tried to refine the mesh and use MINMOD slop limiters, but the result still has oscillation.


using a smoother transition in the boundary condition

The boundary condition in the solid region is the sum of qw_liq and qw_vap. The qw_vap is indeed oscillating. I'm not sure which method should I use to smooth the boundary condition (smooth qw_vap). Could I apply the method in ProjectionAux to the ADmaterial?

By smoothing the BC, I was thinking more of just making a gradual transition from your BC on the left to the BC on the right.
For your question about ProjectionAux, I'm not sure if you could use that somehow and if it would help or not.

I was thinking more of just making a gradual transition from your BC on the left to the BC on the right.

Do you have any suggestions on how to smooth the BC?
For example, you can gradually transition your heat transfer coefficient using something like SmoothTransitionFunction.
OK, I'll have a try. Thanks!

node.title: Invalid Marker value
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I have implemented a modified ErrorToleranceMarker. It pretty much works in the same way as the original ErrorToleranceMarker plus I have few other if conditions which check the current level (_current_elem->level()) of the element and Refine/Coarsen the element based on that. Apart from that, I also run an additional adaptivity step with an increased value of max_h_level, in case a solution step fails. In most of the cases, it works fine but sometimes I see the following error (the value is of course different every time).
Invalid Marker value detected: 0.8125
I have tried to debug it but couldn't find the exact reason. Any clue what is causing this?
Regards.

Thanks for your answer. I return one of the following from the marker, REFINE, COARSEN or DO_NOTHING and I guess they correspond to 1, -1 and 0. I don't understand why it returns a value other than that. It happens when I run an additional adaptivity step on failure.

I don't know either
Do you have something else writing to this variable? Maybe an auxkernel?

node.title: Error while compiling libMesh on HPC: "unsupported/Eigen/IterativeSolvers: No such file or directory"
node.bodyText:
I'm trying to get MOOSE installed on an HPC and I've run into the following error while compiling libMesh using the update_and_rebuild_libmesh script:
  CXX      src/solvers/libmesh_opt_la-eigen_solver.lo
  CXX      src/solvers/libmesh_opt_la-eigen_sparse_linear_solver.lo
  CXX      src/solvers/libmesh_opt_la-eigen_time_solver.lo
../src/solvers/eigen_sparse_linear_solver.C:35:10: fatal error: unsupported/Eigen/IterativeSolvers: No such file or directory
 #include <unsupported/Eigen/IterativeSolvers>
          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
make[1]: *** [Makefile:28913: src/solvers/libmesh_opt_la-eigen_sparse_linear_solver.lo] Error 1
make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/ecclough/projects/moose/libmesh/build'
make: *** [Makefile:33497: all-recursive] Error 1

I successfully built petsc prior to this step using the following:
./scripts/update_and_rebuild_petsc.sh --skip-submodule-update \
--download-cmake=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/cmake-3.28.3.tar.gz \
--download-fblaslapack=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/petsc-pkg-fblaslapack-e8a03f57d64c.tar.gz \

--download-metis=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/petsc-pkg-metis-8b194fdf0966.tar.gz \
--download-slepc=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/slepc-v3.20.1.tar.gz \
--download-parmetis=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/petsc-pkg-parmetis-f5e3aab04fd5.tar.gz \
--download-ptscotch=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/scotch-v7.0.3.tar.gz \
--download-mumps=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/MUMPS_5.6.1.tar.gz \
--download-scalapack=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/scalapack-5bad7487f496c811192334640ce4d3fc5f88144b.tar.gz \
--download-superlu_dist=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/superlu_dist-02b7c0d71bc33e785d098b0f8e4c26414bb8e39a.tar.gz \
--download-strumpack=/home/ecclough/projects/packages/STRUMPACK-7.1.4.tar.gz

after which I ran ./update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh --skip-submodule-update, which throws the above error during compiling. Can someone point me in the right direction to correct this error?
The petsc and libMesh config logs and the libMesh diagnostic log are attached.
config.log
libmesh_diagnostic.log
configure.log

Hello
There are a couple errors in the config.log. Did the first update_and_rebuild_petsc actually download everything well and completed?
Is there a petsc module on your HPC you could use right now?
Guillaume

Here's a workaround:

Download eigen3 (version >= 3.1.2) to an external folder
modify configure script to include --with-eigen-include="external eigen3 directory"

after which libmesh successfully compiles.

node.title: MOOSE Workshop June 6-8
node.bodyText:
Hi everyone,
We will be holding a MOOSE training/workshop June 6-8 in Idaho Falls.
INL has negotiated discounted hotel rates. There will also be a virtual option to attend.
Please register here:
https://inlhrfedramp.gov1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1RDZf244xsF1NK6
Guillaume for the MOOSE team

Dear Moose Team,
Are Workshop slots still available?  I attempted to follow the link and was presented this message:

I think this is not intentional
we ll fix this and get back to you
The link is working again. Please register!
Thank you!
Link is broken again, will keep you posted!
I just register now. I think it's fixed.
nice
I can only attend virtually; is there any agenda available already? Thanks!
Agenda is not available yet. Please register for virtual attendance and it will be sent as soon as we have it

Hi  !
Are you planning to record this workshop and make it available on youtube ? The current video on youtube is already 3 years old.
Kamal

Hello
Yes if the recording goes well
We struggled last year with fixing the recording enough to publish it. It's not easy to hold the training hybrid
Guillaume

Hi ,
Is there anyway to download the workshop slides locally and view it in a browser ? I want to keep the personal copy of the slides.
Thank you very much.
-Kamal

Hello
You can build the documentation locally, then view it in a browser.
You have to build the combined executable in moose/modules then in moose/modules/doc use:
python moosedocs.py build --serve then go to the address listed.
For exporting the slides to pdf, I think it s possible, but I cant remember how
Guillaume

Thank you! This will do for now.  As lots of ppl using the website simultaneously during the workshop, might slow down server, I wanted a local copy.
PDF will also be very helpful. I will ask about it in the Workshop.

As you have noted correctly, I am using Docker image. My HPC has only apptainer. Hence, I pulled the docker image and converted into *.sif format.
I dont understand the concept of submodule and dont know whether the submodules are in working order. As the said, the following commands did not work.
[osu7935@pitzer-login02 scripts]$ $DKMOOSE

Failed to clone 'large_media' a second time, aborting
Apptainer>

My guess is, now that its been converted over to an Apptainer instance, is that you do not have write access to the following location (/opt/). When using Docker, you sign in as root. But the same can not be said with Apptainer. There are switches that allow you to do so that you can try (but I believe certain settings first need to be set on your cluster in order to allow for this feature (/etc/subuid) ref: https://apptainer.org/docs/admin/1.0/user_namespace.html):
apptainer shell --fakeroot /path/to/container.sif
...and then try the git submodule upate --init commands. It should also be mentioned that git submodule update will require network access in order to pull these submodule repos.
If --fakeroot is not available, you can convert your container into a sandboxed one (extract it), and make modifications, etc. The following is not exactly what you want, but the gist of what I do, when I need to "edit" a container:
apptainer build -s /path/to/extracted/container /path/to/container.sif 
cd  /path/to/extracted/container/opt/moose
<do stuff: git submodule, etc while you have write access>
apptainer shell /path/to/extracted/container
Bonus
When all is good, and you like your changes... you can convert this back into a containerized single file:
appatiner build /path/to/new_container.sif /path/to/extracted/container
Edit: Darn, you need --fakeroot to convert it back into a container. But you can still shell "sandboxed" containers without root.

node.title: Gmsh physical curve (line) names disappear for a 3D mesh but not a 2D mesh
node.bodyText:
I have built a 3D mesh in Gmsh to run a thermo-mechanical analysis in MOOSE (see case09 *.i and *.geo files here: https://github.com/Applied-Materials-Technology/pyvale/tree/lf-dev/simcases/case09). I can define physical surfaces and points which appear with the correct name in the set list if I run it through MOOSE and open the exodus in paraview. However, the physical curves (lines) do not appear with the name I give them in the set list after running the thermal analysis but they do appear in gmsh with the correct names. Looking through the node sets in paraview it appears that the physical curves I have defined are appearing as 'nodeset_5' and 'nodeset_6' but they do not have the name specified in gmsh so I cannot apply any boundary conditions on lines in 3D using the specified name.
Interestingly, if I run a 2D gmsh file and define a physical curve everything works fine and I can define boundary conditions using the name I specified for the physical curve in the gmsh file (case07 *.i and *.geo files here: https://github.com/Applied-Materials-Technology/pyvale/tree/lf-dev/simcases/case07).
I can get around this by applying my mechanical boundary conditions on a series of physical points but it should be possible to apply boundary conditions on lines (physical curves) for a 3D mesh. Am I missing something in specifying the gmsh physical curves in 3D or is this a quirk of passing a gmsh mesh to MOOSE?

Hello
Not passing the name seems like a quirk of the gmsh mesh-reading code in libMesh.
If you feel so inclined, it could be changed there.
If not, you can use this to re-establish the sideset names:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/RenameBoundaryGenerator.html
Guillaume
